channel.title: Linear Algebra on 130L
channel.description: Recent content in Linear Algebra on 130L

item.title: quickly calculate determinant of matrix
item.description: 2x2 Matrix Let’s review how to calculate determinant of a 2x2 matrix. For example, given below matrix: \[ det(A) = a11a12-a12a21 \] from the image, we can conclude that it equals to GREEN arrow minus RED arrow. 3x3 Matrix Let’s move to 3x3 matrix, given below matrix: \[ det(A) = a11a22a33 + a12a23a31 + a13a21a32 - a12a21a33 - a11a23a32 - a13a22a31 \] again, from the image, we can conclude that it equals to GREEN arrow minus RED arrow, except that in this time, we write the first column and second column one more time.
